pros:
Compassionate care- 
Always striving care for patients like family. 
Great employee benefits.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Duncan, OK
pros: Friendly, clean, critical access, tuition reimbursement
cons: Micromanaging. Too worried about color of undershirts instead of care, low pay

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Duncan, OK
pros: How much you like a place is directly equal to how well you get along with your coworkers and your supervisor. Luckily I get along well with mine. I know other people in the hospital who have crappy supervisors and/or coworkers. The pay is usually a little bit better because it's considered a rural hospital even though it's pretty large for that area.
cons: Benefits are so-so and seem to go a little more downhill each year. The cafeteria used to be great. Now it's basically a gas station with pre-packaged grab-n-go garbage or heat lamped food. They used to have a mini Starbucks and a Chick Fil-A in the hospital too but shut both down.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Duncan, OK
cons: Pay needs to be raised for loyal employees

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Duncan, OK
pros: If you want extra shifts, it was easy to get them. Supervisors were very understanding and easy to communicate with them. Training was really good.
cons: Need more food options for overnight employees instead of just vending machines just in case you don't bring something.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Duncan, OK
pros: Only working 3 days a week is great, you get to choose your own schedule, on call pay, fun coworkers.
cons: As a cna you will often be floated to sit for EODS, in which you have to sit and stare at them for sometimes your entire shift, with only a few breaks in between, you aren’t allowed to do anything else and if you do, you can get written up. If you’re a female, you could get put with a belligerent man who’s going through psychosis and does try to harm you, they don’t have any men to sit with EODS. I have been attacked multiple times by EODs whilst working here. Dayshift nurses can be very rude to aides, I haven’t had any issues with the night staffing, they’re all very nice to work with. I don’t recommend medsurg unless you are okay with being the only aide for nearing 30 patients and are okay with call lights going off in every direction simultaneously. if you can handle a lot of stress then you will do just fine on medsurg.
small town with not much to do

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Duncan, OK
pros: Great team work on night shift
cons: Limit selections on food during night shift
Not good pay for what you do.

job_title: Remote Stitch Fix Stylist in Duncan, OK
pros: Duncan Regional has great team members and doctors.
Decent insurance, pay, friendly atmosphere for the most part
cons: Horrible supervisor that has been repeatedly turned into hr but nothing done

pros: Working for DRH is good. Benefits fair, staff very friendly and work schedules are set.
cons: evs management very greedy. self serving. the housekeepers work hard and do an outstanding job, but they do NOT GET RECOGNIZED FOR IT.  Management cut corners on supplies so their yearend bonus is  bigger. Housekeepers yearly raise is less than 10 cents . Housekeeping pay is on the lowest paygrade  in the hospital though the work is hard and wirhout housekeepers, the hospital could not function and pass J-CO INSPECTIONS!

pros: Nice co workers, nice patients, and a fantastic place to eat for sure!  I really enjoyed most of the environment.
cons: Low pay, dangerously nosey supervisors who will pry into your private life and don't seem to like people who are genuine.

review_title: I love working at this place.
pros: Fantastic team based environment! Upper management is constantly on the floor asking if anyone needs help or more equipment! Almost all the staff are friendly and smiling. Love working here. Self scheduling.
cons: None that most other hospitals don't already face. Wonderful compared to most large hospitals
